title: I HAD THE TIME OF MY LIFE!!!!
text:
Absolutely the best resort we have ever visited! It has been a week of constant fun, enjoyment, music, laughter and quite honestly the best resort ever!!! Nixon, Boni, Luis Bautista Rafael (wachi) Raphael, Alexandro, Alejandro , Reynaldo, Minerva, Dark Chocolate, Friman in Aqua and Manuel TORRES have made it the best time ever! We will absolutely be returning next year!!! So much to do here! The Michael Jackson show and Queen concert were amazing! Took a catamaran to the private island, snorkeled, and really enjoyed this amazing trip! The restaurants are first class and 5 start dining and the service is without a doubt the best and most respectful! Book your trip today! You will thank me! Wow! What a place! LOVE IT!!!! MANUEL Torres is unbelievable!!!! Our dinners at Aqua and  Mizu were amazing and so is he!!!!  
Take a vacation and come  to Paradise!!!  Wow!!!!

title: True Builders
text:
We had True Builders replace our roof that was damaged by a hail storm. The company was amazing !! I rate them as a 5* as The Best!! Costumer service was So Good, very nice and cordial, explaining every step!! Was on time from start to finish!!  Stacy did our scheduling, and scheduled payments, Jeff was our adjuster and Lee was in charge of the job!! I want both of them again if I ever need the company again!!! Lee was very honest, true to his word, treated our home like it was his own, really meant a lot to us!! Lee talked to us like we were his family, knew us for ever !! We could truly feel Lee‚Äôs love in his job, every other word was Please, Thank you, yes Man, yes Sir, those words go a very long ways!!
Thank you True Builders

title: Worse every update
text:
I travel a lot. 32 weeks out of the year, to be exact. And I have been trusting Google Maps to get me around each new city and small town I encounter...

But with each update to the app, it seems to get less reliable. I had been holding off on the last 3 or 4 updates when my iPhone 6 finally stopped working for good yesterday, so I upgraded to an iPhone 8. Well, the newest version of Google Maps was installed, and today is my first try of real world use.

Disappointed to report that while driving on an interstate the app thought I was driving on the outer road 3 times during the trip. Just out of nowhere, going down a straight interstate the app suddenly tells me to make a left turn to get back on the highway. Not once, not twice, but THREE times. Glitchy? I need this to work. I‚Äôm giving up just as much personal information to Google just like everyone else. The least you can do is keep your app reliable. Why ‚Äúfix‚Äù something that wasn‚Äôt broken in the first place?

Also, I don‚Äôt know who is working on your UI, but you just need to stop. Just stop what you‚Äôre doing and go do something else. Go to the park. Adopt a puppy. Do ANY THING ELSE but continue to screw up the UI that worked completely fine (and was more efficient) in previous versions of this app.

title: Constantly gets things wrong
text: So many issues. First, there are flat out errors like some areas where you‚Äôre instructed to turn into a median (that has been there for years) and completely making up bus location data so even though the app says a bus will arrive within minutes and is down the block, it may actually be a half hour away or not on the way at all- I‚Äôve been left stranded more than once because I relied on google maps. The other big problem is the simplistic algorithm that seems to be programmed to give you the fastest route, regardless of how unreasonable that option may be - for example, you may be instructed to take a new route to save 1 min but adds 5 turns. DO NOT TRUST THIS APP, it will consistently make up data that you‚Äôll plan your trip around and you‚Äôll get screwed. Google maps should be forced to remove their bus tracker since it is reliably wrong.

title: Amazing time, with trophy fish
text: I have fished on the Pacific, Gulf of Mexico, now the Atlantic, bucket list checked off. On all the charters I have been on over the years I have never caught or heard of a tagged fish that if caught you win a prize. Captain Jeremiah was very knowledgeable of the area and took us to monster red fish 30+ pounds. To be able to be on a charter and feel like you were just out with friends was truly a day to remember. This will be a place I will talk about for years to come. This will not be the last time I come back to fish here. Captain Jeremiah came highly recommended and our day on the water was more than I could have asked for. Thanks again for a memorable trip and huge trophy fish.

title: Stop rerouting me, for heaven‚Äôs sake
text:
I understand the appeal of getting automatically rerouted to a faster route. But it‚Äôs so annoying to choose a slightly slower route for your own reasons and then get rerouted in the middle of it. 

Recent example: I was driving home with a new tv in my trunk. It was slightly too large and I had to strap it in. I knew the main roads back to my house but didn‚Äôt know all of the turns, so I used the app. Noticed the quickest route was on a road with AWFUL potholes and crazy drivers so I chose a route that was 3 minutes slower to avoid it. I spent 15 minutes fighting with the app before pulling into a Starbucks to write down the instructions like it was 2006. 

With the amount of stress and effort it takes to get Maps to do a relatively simple thing, following the single task I gave it, there is no reason for it to be on my phone.

title: Not helpful if you own a business
text: As a business owner, one would think I would have control over how my business is presented on Google Maps. This app is not user-friendly at all. I can‚Äôt see what my page actually looks like. I try to submit photos and they are rejected, with no explanation. Sometimes I try to resize it & it‚Äôll work, & others I can‚Äôt. I have tried repeatedly to put a logo for my business on my page, or to control how the photos show up, hoping that the latest photos would be the first ones that are seen. But no, it shuffles around so I never know what they‚Äôre going to use as my logo, or what order the photos are in. Trying to find things like how to add current articles with new product release info takes way too much time. Why not give business owners more control over their actual content, and make the app more intuitive and easier to use?

title: Fix traffic problem
text:
Update: After my poor review comprising about the traffic toggling off all the time, the developers fixed this feature and replied to my review. Google maps is better again, and I appreciate the quick developer response. I use the app every day to plan my commute and am happy that it works great again!

Original Review: I agree with other reviewers. It used to be that once turned on, traffic showed up every time you started the app. Now you have to turn it on each time. Very frustrating! I may switch to a different map app if this is not fixed soon. I rely on the traffic maps to plan my commute, and toggling traffic on is difficult in the car.

title: "Arrive by" functionality ruined
text: The "arrive by" function in the iphone app no longer works.  Previously you could enter a destination and set the time you want to arrive, and it would tell you when to leave. The app no longer does this.  This functionality is still present on the website. However, with the app, they have taken away the view to see when you actually have to leave. The worst part is that the base functionality still exists in the app, as you can now tick a box at the bottom to have google make a reminder for you to leave, they have just removed the ability for you to see when to leave on your own, so you have to either use the website or be at the whim of your phone, waiting until it tells you it‚Äôs time to leave through a reminder that may, depending on how your phone and alerts are set up, you might not get anyway.

title: So confusing
text: Google maps was the one app I rely on when ever I get on the road. But last night that all changed when I used it to go from Yucaipa, Ca. to chino hills, Ca. At 9 pm at night.  It all started normal then it, all of a sudden, directed me to get off the freeway and take the road and I did as directed and ended up in a winded canyon road with barely any street light. I drove for at least 50 minutes before I realized I am getting lost.  My car almost hit a curve and flipped. I was visibly shaking and couldn‚Äôt drive anymore. I parked my car and switched to Apple Maps and got to the nearest freeway immediately. Then, i wanted to see if it‚Äôs working again so I switched to google maps. You would think it will finely figure it out since I am on the right route. No! It tried to take me back to the canyon roads. It almost seems like it‚Äôs intention is sinister. Will never use google maps again. Just couldn‚Äôt trust it!

title: SF Muni bus time prediction is horrible
text: The app is unusable if you take transit in San Francisco, it frequently reports that a bus is coming for busses that will never show up. I‚Äôve often been left sitting at the bus stop for 30 minutes to an hour after it‚Äôs first predicted bus ETA. It doesn‚Äôt happen only once either, it can happen multiple times at the same stop where you look at the ETA of the next bus, that ETA comes, no bus shows up, and the next ETA it gives you is 15 minutes out from the last one and you repeat until you get lucky. There needs to be better integration with the bus system for accuracy, I‚Äôve used Google Maps for transit directions in Toronto, Vancouver, Waterloo, and New York City for years and have never encountered this problem until I moved to San Francisco. With it‚Äôs current bad predictions, the app is unusable in this city which is sad since it works better abroad than in Google‚Äôs home turf.

title: Google - you know usability. Please do better.
text:
Google- you know usability. You can do better. I want it to to be easy to find say a pet store along the route that I‚Äôm following a google map. If I pick up my phone to look for a store your app either shows me home places or places Right where I am. I want efficient routes. Places that are closest all along my route. I want to add them with one click. I want google to make suggestions for efficiency on the order of the stops (and I want to be able to change them).  Then when I stop at the first place and turn off me engine thereby decoupling my phone from my car, I want you to both remember my plan and have communicated it to my car.

It‚Äôs not at all easy to enter multi stop maps. And the frustration way outweighs the benefit. Then, when you disconnect from your car on a long trip to say get coffee, Directions all vanish. It‚Äôs an opening in the market. You are fast. Please fix it.

title: Nearly perfect
text: I completely depend on this app as a provider of health care services to homes. I enter many addresses daily, and have enjoyed the recent addition of the timeline feature as a backup to my record keeping. One innovation in the most recent update that I dislike is that when the destination is entered, the graphic focuses immediately on the area closely surrounding the address. Previously, a small schematic of the whole route popped up first, before activating the start button. If most of the route was familiar, I could leave the app off until I needed it for final turns‚Äîmuch better than hearing directions from my own driveway to the entrance of my neighborhood, and on all the way to the destination. Please restore the whole-route schematic at the beginning!

title: Change it back or people will get killed! [Edit: FIXED]
text:
Before, when you swiped the map as you were driving along your route, the map moved where your finger did, so you could easily see ahead what turns you might need to take. Now when you swipe it does this weird perspective shift, where you lose the route and have to search for it, and that‚Äôs completely distracting while you‚Äôre driving. This is going to get people killed on the road. Change it back before you cause possibly hundreds of deaths.

EDIT: They fixed this problem! It‚Äôs back to normal, so I‚Äôm giving them FIVE STARS! Thank you for listening to your customers. I hope this didn‚Äôt cause any unnecessary deaths in the interim.

title: Edits keep being rejected, yet Apple Maps can figure out correct street data
text:
I‚Äôve submitted numerous map edits for our property, all of which have been rejected or accepted but unpublished.

First, a road running through our property was abandoned years go by our county.  The county‚Äôs GIS map shows no road traveling through our land, yet Google has repeatedly rejected all map edits requesting that this road be removed.  Numerous vehicles have attempted to use this road and have gotten stuck on our property. Numerous people have faced trespassing violations because they [incorrectly] relied on Google Maps to provide accurate information about public and private lands.  We even had one encounter turn somewhat violent with a person on an ATV who insisted he was on public property.  

Secondly, numerous edit suggestions regarding the name of the street we live on have either been rejected, or accepted but unpublished.  Referring again to county‚Äôs OFFICIAL map site shows accurate road name information, yet Google continues to show incorrect info.  

Apple Maps has managed to show all of the correct info, I‚Äôm not sure why Google struggles to use publicly available data to present the most accurate map information to its users, or outright rejects map edits from its users giving the most accurate and up to date info.

title: Saved Places are Missing from Map
text: Recently within the past few days or so I‚Äôve noticed that I have zero saved places in any list or category anymore except for labels. The saved places I had in different states are now gone and I cannot access them unless I go to the saved tab and click ‚Äúview your collections‚Äù which takes me to a separate site I can view the links to all my previous saved places. Why are these not on the map anymore?? Is that not the point of saving things on a map?? I hope this is a bug caused by the new update or something because I cannot easily see or access any of my places anymore. And, yes, I‚Äôm signed in on the same google account on the app that my saved places are connected to. It makes no sense for me to go to an alternate site to see my saved places within my Google account instead of on the app. Please fix this.

title: Annoying crappy app designed to collect your information.
text: Going downhill steadily for years. Used to be a decent app but now every 2.3 seconds if I'm not on the screen it wants me to be on, it automatically moves it back and there's no way to turn it off. Drives me nuts when I'm trying to see where google wants me to go and all of a sudden the screen moves on me, then I move it back and maps changes it again. Not to mention all the useless information like weather that clutters up the screen when you're trying to navigate. Half the time the traffic info doesn't load even though everything else works and signal isn't a problem. Tried it on wifi too and still problems. Google needs to be a thing of the past they're a very evil company if you look into it and their stuff is junk. Bugs galore. Do they even have a quality control department?

title: Not live syncing or changing stations on Transits/ Buses
text:
I am currently using the uodated google mqp version 15.2.1 on iPhone 13 Pro. When I am using the google map for subway or transits and I'm on the bus or train, its in a static mode and not live syncing. The transit icon on the top page is not moving with me. I have no way of knowing my stops/stations (even when the GPS and data were all working). 
I have tried everything from toggling "location services" in the "privacy settings", giving every access inside the google app under the "settings", compass toggling in the "settings", toggling the "content and privacy restrictions" in the "screen time settings" to reinstalling the google map, resetting the location and privacy settings and even factory reset but nothing helped. Please help me on how to resolve this. I would really appreciate this since I use google map very frequently and very much rely on it.

title: No option to add new housing
text: The app is pretty good, if you‚Äôre trying to find an address that has existed for a while. It‚Äôll put you right at the place you want to go, assuming some approved entity has input it into Google‚Äôs system. I recently moved into a new home, and am having a hard time getting some of my packages delivered. There is an option in the app to add a new place, but no option to add a private residence. I have to stand outside and wave down any expected deliveries/visitors using any map application. This app would be fantastic, if people could actually have a way to input new homes, with a way to verify. Other than that one issue, the app is great, and it‚Äôs only the frustration of not being allowed to place my own home on the map that keeps it from being a five-star app.

title: So buggy!!! You‚Äôre Google!! Fix it!!
text:
Trying to contribute photos to maps can be fun, but it can also be super frustrating.  This part of the app should never have left Beta testing.  Adding photos is ridiculous, you can only see 5,000 or so pics from your camera roll and not in added order, it‚Äôs by date taken (I have 90k photos in my iPhoto and half a million photos in my archives) 

Then, if you click on a picture, the album changes, nearby photos disappear and *sometimes* nearby pics are at the top of the list, but usually they simply vanish. 

I understand views are supposed to update every 24hrs, but I‚Äôve been keeping track, and it hasn‚Äôt updated in 6 days.  

This could be a very valuable tool for photographers and people looking to explore.  I‚Äôm not sure, but it seems like my pics with a lot of views are moving to the front.  

Oh and video quality is worse than a compressed video off a Motorola rzr from 2003.  I thought Instagram was bad.  

Just trying to build my social credit score ya know? 

Oh and please make navigation more like Waze and have it display my current speed next to the speed limit.  You guys own Waze, just mix the two apps and have the option to switch views.  I love seeing aerial imagery with my navigation, but Waze generally works better.  Please spend time and effort on apps like this.  Please.

title: Hiatt construction Tennessee
text:
Late in 2019 we had a leak that destroyed our hardwood floors. We had used Hiatt Construction for small jobs over several years and asked them to help us work with our repair and associated remodeling. They were excellent and had the lowest price. Much of the cost of the damage was covered by insurance and Hiatt dealt directly with the insurance company and kept us well informed over the 3+ months it took to complete everything. 

While a large construction project is never easy or without complications this went about as smooth as any I have ever been associated with. (My father was a general contractor and I had lots of person experience with the business over many years,)

Hiatt handled all subcontractors and every business involved with our project. They made sure we were fully informed and knew our options and helped get it done!

And they followed up on everything we asked them to do including dealing with any mistakes or damage done by subcontractors in a timely manner. 

We recommend Hiatt without reservation and continue to use them whenever we can on projects big or small!

Alan Wentz
Germantown TN

title: A Must Have City Exploration App
text: Google maps has been my favorite app due to its list saving ability for locations. It makes it really easy to save and group different types of restaurants into lists. By far the best city exploration app that exists. For future updates i would absolutely love to see the implementation of a list search bar in the ‚Äúmy places‚Äù tab. It gets kind of tiresome scrolling through all of my lists and trying to find the right one to save a new place into. If i could search through my lists and instantly identify the right one it would drastically improve my user experience. Other than that I absolutely love this app and I will continue to use it for city exploration.

title: Gets the Job Done
text: I still prefer this app to anything else, but I find myself often debating switching to another. I don't like that it only will go into dark mode when you're actually using it to drive. Every other screen is still bright. Also, sometimes it gives me the wrong directions and I have to end up figuring out on my own how to finish getting somewhere. I've also caught myself going in circles before because of my current location not updating fast enough when driving. I wish too that you could get different voice options for the navigation. Again, overall it's a fine app; it does what it needs to, but I just see much room for improvement on the little things that'll make it incredible.

title: Strange orientation
text: I find this app mostly easy to use but found that one of the recent updates is so idiotic it boggles my mind. Previously, when you use the app and you‚Äôre driving, the icon for the vehicle in which you‚Äôre traveling is up (when the phone is mounted in front of me). Now when you turn or whichever way you‚Äôre going the icon for your car could be going up, down, left, or right. Never before with any GPS or Maps application have I ever seen that. It‚Äôs VERY disorienting to be driving and see the icon moving down, then it tells me to turn right, and watching the icon turn left on the screen. What genius came up with that? Rotate the map as the user is moving so the icon is always going in the same direction. It‚Äôs truly not that difficult.

title: Surprisingly Disappointing for Public Transportation Routes (Weekday and Weekends alike!)
text:
I‚Äôve been using Google Maps since as long as I remember. Since I‚Äôve moved to a certain part of Brooklyn this app has been the absolute worst. I always have to uninstall then install it again, it never knows my location, and more often than not the results I get for a trip are ‚Äúcan‚Äôt find a way there.‚Äù 

I keep this app updated, my location services are always on for this app and I have great cell phone service in my area. I have no issues with other apps that require location services, such as Uber and Lyft. 

Not sure what‚Äôs going on with this app. I thought it was a glitch or something, but the issues above are recurring and have been since for the last several months. The app works great when I‚Äôm not a planning at trip from my house to anywhere else via public transportation.

title: I used to love this app but not so much now
text: Google maps used to be more accurate. There was an update recently that has changed the way the app is reading my location. It‚Äôs not as precise and often does not zoom in closer to my location when I am in neighborhoods or areas with lots of streets. It has made navigating these areas a bit stressful because I have to slow down and wait for google maps to catch up with me. It also seems to change its mind about my position on the street when I‚Äôm stopped at a stop sign or in a parking lot (or even just parked on the street.) It will show my position correctly for a moment and then decide I‚Äôm facing 90¬∞ to the right and recalculate my directions based on that. Then when I start moving again it has to recalculate again. I don‚Äôt trust Google maps anymore and will probably start using my iPhone Maps app instead.

title: GUYS, urgent!!! DEV TEAM!!!
text: GUYS, urgent!!! DEV TEAM!!! Why can‚Äôt we see a real time traffic situation, once you open the app???? It is sooo inconvenient now, i open the app, and i don't see anything regarding real time traffic for that given moment when i launch the app. It is crucial for everyday drivers to see big picture of traffic in any city. I drive everyday in NYC, i used to open Google maps to see what the traffic is like, yes it was adjusted to it from the beginning once you download the app, but you could go to settings and simply turn that feature on. Now you can‚Äôt do it. I went from a to z in this new update, and nothing. Put that feature back in the app, pls!!! Giving 1 star , until its back. It is useless app now.

title: it turned me onto a back road and my car slid off the ice and i had to pay a 200$ tow bill LOL
text:
wish it was possible for it to consider weather/road conditions more rather than just choosing what would be fastest in clear conditions. from northern michigan in the thick of winter & with the polar vortex, most back/dirt roads are covered in ice, unplowed, edges not visible through the snow, slippery, etc. (basically: dangerous!) i wish there was a ‚Äútake main roads‚Äù option or at least a way to override the time priority in favor of a more-traveled route that might add a few more minutes to the drive. ‚Äúprefer paved roads‚Äù, maybe? 

i love google maps and its functions in warmer weather, but it did nearly kill me while trying to navigate me through an unfamiliar area to get to class last week soooo... eh...

title: Effortless Exploration App üìç
text: Absolutely indispensable! Google Maps is my go-to app for navigating the world. Whether I'm driving, walking, or using public transportation, it always provides accurate, reliable directions. The real-time traffic updates have saved me from countless delays, and the ability to explore nearby places, read reviews, and see photos is incredibly helpful when I'm looking for somewhere new to visit. The recent addition of features like offline maps and indoor navigation has made this app even more versatile. I can't imagine getting around without it. Thank you, Google Maps, for making my life so much easier!

title: Not cool Google. NOT COOL!
text:
This app has always been an indispensable tool for me. But with the addition of live traffic (in my city) and custom labels recently, it's become an invaluable navigation app. Thank you Google for this app. I generally don't rate and review applications, but I just had to give the new Google Maps the 5 stars it so rightly deserves.

UPDATE:
Took away one star because navigation, location-sharing, and review-writing don‚Äôt work in my country. Another star because directions stopped working, too! I hope it‚Äôs just a bug and not another one of Google‚Äôs arbitrary policies of disabling features for certain countries. Come on Google. DON‚ÄôT BE EVIL!
BTW, Apple Maps is much more accurate and  detailed than Google Maps now. If Google decides to disable its one saving grace, i.e. directions, altogether, I might as well use the superior Apple Maps.

title: Please bring back 2D view while navigating, especially on CarPlay
text:
I‚Äôm a longtime Google Map user and I favor Google Map over Apple Maps for almost everything and one of the main reasons being that Google Maps stays in 2D while navigating. Yet the recent updates or at least the beta testing really are the worst experiences I‚Äôve had with Google Maps in years.

The new color scheme is absolutely awful on the eyes. The saturation is so high that it actually decreases the contrast between roads and direction arrows. Those arrows are even harder to see on CarPlay due to this low contrast issue and being very small. 

The other thing was changing the navigation to 3D. Terrible terrible experience on CarPlay. The 3D buildings take a while render completely and the resolution is so low near the edge of the screen that it actually hurts looking at the screen. And these blocks of 3D cubes that contribute nothing to my trips are really just there to distract me from reading my actual routes. They also half block some of the roads on the map and making them hard to see. There are people that just don‚Äôt like 3D maps. 

Please give users the option to select color scheme and 2D vs 3D.

title: Version 6.96.1 STILL laggy, glitchy & freezes
text: 1) Freezes while scrolling through specific lists, within Saved Places. (This did not occur until about the last several updates.) Gotta flip the app out of memory and re-launch it - hoping you can scroll down to the saved item BEFORE it locks up again! 2) ALSO problematic since the last several updates, laggy graphics. i.e. - populating the app with buttons, pix, etc. EVEN while on very fast WiFi. 3) Laggy/freezes while trying to enter text into location notes section 4) Longtime continuing issue: Saved Places are listed in RANDOM order, with no way to re-order them‚Ä¶ which makes finding a specific one, more-than-tedious‚Ä¶ REALLY annoying. If the user isn‚Äôt given any control over that, at least list them alphabetically, PLEASE! ================= iPad Mini 6: On latest iOS with latest versions of all apps installed.

title: Google maps
text:
I‚Äôve enjoyed of course how to find my destination while travelingüòäI totally like looking where I‚Äôve been seeing pictures I taken at those momentsüôÇI also enjoy seeing that other‚Äôs enjoyed my reviews üòä
Thank you Google Map‚Äôs and to all those who enjoy my reviews and my photograph‚Äôs .üòä
Enjoy Life‚Äôs Journey each day night,As pages turn new characters begin üôÇLive Life surround yourself with other‚Äôs like you also while you are out and about Share your Smile don‚Äôt be afraid to say Hello or even a conversation with someone you never met or maybe only for that moment The world and all it‚Äôs beauty Be You the rest is easy all comes naturally. Positive Pleasure Peace

title: While trying to give this app more features, functionality has been compromised.
text: Lately has been switching routes a lot even if I picked a route. I know sometimes there‚Äôs a button that pops up that says if I don‚Äôt want to switch routes press the button but I‚Äôm driving it should be the opposite. Especially because sometimes it freezes the map and my location or route isn‚Äôt shown at all. Additionally google maps doesn‚Äôt seem to understand how ferry lines work. Everytime I ask for directions to the ferry it trys to take you through back roads because the traffic is ‚Äúheavy‚Äù. It‚Äôs illegal to cut in front of the ferry traffic line, the traffic is heavy because it‚Äôs the line for tickets. Why can‚Äôt it just route to the correct road for ferry traffic?

title: Maps could be better but it works.
text:
Maps can get you where you want to go. There are some problems as well. In the last year or so I noticed how the program gets lost. I‚Äôm driving down a highway and it has my car in a cornfield. Then it tries to get me back on the highway. Similar things happen in more urban settings but I think you get the idea.
I think it should also warn or have alerts for speed cameras or areas you need to change speed. In Chicago there can be an area where you need to slow down 5-10 mph accompanied by a camera. It‚Äôs really hard to watch drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists etc and see every time you need to change speeds. 
I like this better than Waze and the maps that come on iphone I just think it could be improved.

title: Beware of rerouting without notification!
text: If you live in an area with toll roads, such as DFW, beware of this app. I don‚Äôt turn on the ‚Äúavoid tolls‚Äù setting because I like to see my options (time/cost) for tolls vs no tolls. Every single time I choose the ‚Äúno tolls‚Äù route on the map and start driving, it attempts to route me towards the tollway without notifying me. This is EXTREMELY frustrating!! I can‚Äôt change my route back to what I wanted it to be in the first place while driving and be safe at the same time. This is ridiculous. If I purposely choose the non tollway route, THAT‚ÄôS the route I expect to take regardless of if it‚Äôs faster on the tollway. Luckily, there were times when I partially knew the route already as the app attempted over and over again to make me take the tollway. I feel for anyone who tries use this app and is completely new to an area.

title: Where would I be without Google Maps ü§î
text:
I have been using Google Maps for the last 5-6 years, I used to rely on other maps, but Google has become my favorite.
I live in Bali - Indonesia, and I couldn‚Äôt honestly get around without guidance of some sort. I am truly impressed by the accuracy, also the fact that I can download the map and still works offline‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt know how that works, but I absolutely love it.‚ù§Ô∏è

I drive a car, and sometimes I have been lead to crazy roads that maybe only a bike can get through, but I still can turn around and find another route, meaning I am never lost ‚Ä¶ thanks for making this app better every time üôèüèº

title: Not recognizing my home address
text: I have tried everything I know to input my address in the app but it doesn‚Äôt recognize it. I am started using the Maps program on my iPhone because it recognizes my address. The best feature of that is that I get turn by turn notifications on my Apple Watch which is really an asset because if you get busy talking on the phone or something it let you know that you got a turn coming up. The best feature about Google Maps is that you can store all your places and different files, like shopping, grocery stores, doctors offices, and so forth. But I can‚Äôt get a starting point for my house so what good is it?

title: Cant customize route
text: I used to love google maps, but it no longer allows you to choose or customize a route. I was driving home from a recent trip and wanted to take a route that is longer time wise but avoids the city. This app gave me a few options to choose from before departing and I chose one avoiding said city. 10 mins into the drive it updated my route. So I had my wife who was a passenger change it, and it updated again. We fought the app for 15 mins or so before deciding that we‚Äôd just do what the app said and stop trying to go the way we wanted too. So at this point its trying to route us through the city again that we‚Äôve already halfway bypassed. It ended up taking us longer to get home than if we‚Äôd gone the initial long but scenic way and we still had to drive through the city. Anyway I like being able to choose a route, I‚Äôm going to find another app.

title: The best
text: This app is a very impressive app it has the 3D walk were you can walk on a road and find out what‚Äôs around you. you can also can use google maps to find stores homes and businesses. You can also use the directional gps. I really love the app because it is a great way to learn everything around you. Now there is only one way to make it even better that is if you can get to walk in a building because I like to see what is inside of a building. That would be really fun and very interesting for other people to experience what‚Äôs inside big buildings. This is a great app I love it and I never have problems with it it loads instantly and it is ten times better than maps on an iPhone.

title: Please update toll/no tolls options
text: First time writing a review like this EVER because I‚Äôm over it. Google seriously needs to update its Toll Road toggle. 1) Sometimes I want to see toll road options, sometimes I don‚Äôt. When I turn the toggle on, sometimes I just want to see if using tolls will get me there any quicker. Don‚Äôt ONLY show toll road options though. You should also show the non-toll options to my destination. 2) If I pick a non-toll road option with the toll toggle turned on, it will STILL take me on a toll every time. After choosing a non-toll option, if I miss a turn and don‚Äôt go the original way, it will re-route me to a toll road. That is incredibly frustrating. Please offer an option where I can see ALL my trip options, both toll and non-toll. And if I select a non-toll option do not re-route to me a toll! Put me back on my original route!

title: What happened?? GARBAGE
text: This has been my go to app for seven years. What I always loved about Google maps was, I was able to go back on my timeline and revisit places I‚Äôve been to, Road trips I‚Äôve taken, memories I want to remember. There is always that satisfaction that if there was a particular day I remembered going on a particular vacation, I would go back to the timeline. I find this app completely discouraging as I go back on my timeline and I‚Äôm getting several weeks to months of ‚Äú No visited Places‚Äù when I know darn well I looked in the same spots a few months back and there were places I visited in the exact same time spots and days. I find this absolutely horrendous because I‚Äôve spent years checking into a bunch of places on Google maps, constantlyContributing to trying to make the Google maps better with no return. It‚Äôs not fun anymore and I want to find another platform.

title: It‚Äôs the best app out there!
text: It works great for bicycling directions, which is great for me, as I don‚Äôt drive, but what disappoints me is that it doesn‚Äôt support Dark mode on iOS 13, while Apple maps does. But Apple maps doesn‚Äôt provide bicycling directions, which is another disappointment for me. I hope the developers will find a way to support dark mode. This is the only app that provides bicycling directions while as Apple maps along with Waze that don‚Äôt, so I‚Äôm afraid that I‚Äôll have to strain my eyes when looking for a place during the night time, so I‚Äôll just have to put the brightness all the way down and hope that it doesn‚Äôt go back up while navigating. It really annoys me that I have to do it that way, and I don‚Äôt want to walk away from this app. So please support dark mode real soon guys, then I‚Äôll give it five stars!

title: Gets confused
text: I do get good general direction when I do the initial search. However, as I‚Äôm driving with the app running Google Maps gets confused and thinks I‚Äôm on the access roads and keeps verbally telling me to re-enter the highway even though I have never left the highway. Then it repeatedly tells me to take exits that are not the ones taking me to my destination. Then, each time, it recalculated another inappropriate exit. I have been misguided into taking the wrong way by this app in the past causing me to be late because of an extremely extended travel time. Since then I‚Äôve learned to question what it‚Äôs telling me and I have to decide what to believe and what to just ignore. This morning was extraordinarily error filled. That‚Äôs not good when I have an important destination. I hope that this app gets its issues remedied.

title: Great service, and a great price!
text: We were selling our 1912 farm home and needed to replace the windows in order to get a sale.  D&W gave us the lowest of the 3 bids, but also we felt it is a great quality window.  The installation people showed up at 10am and had replaced 11 windows, and cleaned up and they were gone by 4:30pm.  Shortly after, we sold our home.  We would definitely recommend them again. My husband is a contractor, but his specialty is not in windows and after coming home after a long week of work, he was relieved to have the project completed with out him having to do the work.  We only wish we would have had D&W come and do that project a few years earlier so we could enjoy the windows, too.

title: EDITED- No more traffic default?!?  WHY???
text:
Edit:  THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU for bringing the default traffic layer back!!!! 5 stars again üôåüèº  I love you.  Seriously.  

***************
I've been a loyal Google Maps user for years.  It's the best map for traffic out there, until recently.  With whatever update, you guys removed the default to traffic option.  We now have to toggle traffic on each time we open the app üòñ Since I'd think most people use your app FOR ACTUAL TRAFFIC when commuting or directions...this change is a huge misstep. It's one thing to take it away, then have an option to turn it on in settings...but that's not even there.  Please change it back or give us an option.  Thank you!

title: Don't think twice!!!
text: I've been searching for a dentist for quite some time now, and honestly, god has answered my prayers my search has finally stopped I've dealt with so many nasty dentist places and you would never believed my story I'm so honored to have him now and forever in my life and my childrens life his staff are so professional and helpful and generous you'd be foolish to turn him and his practice away not only has he met every of my important needs he definitely has a great heart and is a very genuine dentist it felt like home every step and he has forever changed my life I cannot wait to proceed in this new chapter with him as my new dentist and I would never have to bring me or my children anywhere else!

title: Should be able to exclude certain roads
text:
Generally this app works great. However you should be able to exclude certain roads or areas as possible routes.  I‚Äôm near chicago and when my daughter goes to visit her boyfriend in Indiana, the app will often send her down the Dan Ryan expressway in chicago, which is a shooting gallery.   It will often take her off the highway to surface roads to maybe avoid an accident and now she‚Äôs in CarJack Territory. 

And this route only saves like 10 minutes as opposed to the preferred route which is staying on the 294 tollway and avoiding that crime ridden liberal craphole we know as chicago. 

Really Google. This should be an easy item to add so your app doesn‚Äôt send our kids through the hood to get shot at or car jacked.

title: New update is annoying
text: The app has ALWAYS opened to a clear search bar with the map in my current location (when freshly opening the app after it was closed after the last use) so I can start a fresh route or destination with one click.  NOW it opens to the last route you searched or mapped, even if it‚Äôs somewhere far away.  It‚Äôs very very obnoxious that I have to click so many times go back or clear the route before I put in a new one.  Not to mention the latest update is laggy so when I‚Äôm trying I click fast to clear the route so I can type in a new one, I inevitably click the wrong thing because of the screen delay and it is INFURIATING!!!!  It‚Äôs getting to the point where I will be soon switching to another map app and that says a lot since I have only ever used google maps since the day of its inception..  I looked in settings to see if I could turn this off but found no obvious solution.

title: Getting better, needs to let me specify an alternate route
text:
A badly needed feature that mapquest used to have is to allow users to specify a point I want on my trip. I love that google maps brings up multiple routes, but it doesn‚Äôt always show all logical routes and some that are clearly out of the question. If I could add a point on the map that I want to go through, I could see another alternate route. My example is the Washington DC beltway. Living on the western side of the city I would like to see whether to take the north loop or the south loop when traveling to Route 50 in Maryland. The app never shows the south loop. I know it‚Äôs a little longer, but it‚Äôs a much easier ride if the traffic isn‚Äôt bad. 

Also, I still need to use Waze after checking google maps routes, because of the alerts feature in Waze.
